words.definition: To alert someone is to tell or warn them about something.
words.example: The fire alarm alerted us that there was a problem.

words.definition: A broadcast is a television or radio show.
words.example: We watched the broadcast of the local news on TV.

words.definition: A bulletin is a news report that talks about very recent and important events.
words.example: There was a live bulletin reporting on the economy of the city.

words.definition: To bump is to hit something, for example, with your hand or leg, by accident.
words.example: I bumped my knee on the corner of the table.

words.definition: To chop is to cut something into pieces with a tool.
words.example: Mom chopped some vegetables for the stew.

words.definition: A closet is a small room or part of a room used for storing things.
words.example: I put my coat in the closet.

words.definition: To console someone who is sad means to make them comforted.
words.example: When my dog ran away, my dad consoled me.

words.definition: A district is a small part of a city or country.
words.example: I live in a busy district of the city.

words.definition: A drawer is a part of a piece of furniture that slides in and out.
words.example: I put my socks in the bottom drawer.

words.definition: To endure is to experience and deal with something difficult or painful.
words.example: She had to endure a lot of pain after her accident.

words.definition: To execute is to do something that has been planned or agreed.
words.example: The team executed their plan perfectly.

words.definition: To grasp something is to hold it firmly with your hands.
words.example: He grasped the handle of the door and pulled it open.

words.definition: The rear of something is the back part of it.
words.example: The door at the rear of the building was locked.

words.definition: A senator is a person who is part of a government group that makes laws.
words.example: The senator spoke to the people about the new law.

words.definition: A skull is the hard part of the head which protects the brain.
words.example: The doctor showed me a picture of a human skull.

words.definition: To stir is to mix something by moving a tool around in it.
words.example: He stirred the sugar into his coffee.

words.definition: To tap is to hit something lightly and quickly.
words.example: He tapped on the window to get her attention.

words.definition: If something is tremendous, it is very large or very good.
words.example: The fireworks display was tremendous.

words.definition: Underneath means below or under something else.
words.example: The cat was hiding underneath the bed.

words.definition: A worm is a small, long, thin animal that lives in the ground.
words.example: The bird ate the worm that it found in the garden.
